meanings.definition: The plural form of 'dodo', referring to an extinct flightless bird.
meanings.sent1: The dodoes were large birds that could not fly.
meanings.sent2: I read about the dodoes in a book about extinct animals.
meanings.sent3: The dodoes in the story were friendly creatures that loved to eat fruits.
meanings.sent4: In the tale, the dodoes symbolized the fragility of nature.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dodoes waddling around the island stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'dodo', referring to a foolish or stupid person.
meanings.sent1: He always hangs out with dodoes who make poor decisions.
meanings.sent2: The group of dodoes at the party were causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: The dodoes thought it was a good idea to play with firecrackers indoors.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was surrounded by dodoes who couldn't understand her.
meanings.sent5: The dodoes in the comedy show made everyone laugh with their silly antics.
